title: Docs missing about the machine instruction that could be emitted by `core::hint::spin_loop`

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

body:
[The documentation for `core::hint::spin_loop`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/hint/fn.spin_loop.html) only mentions that a non-specific machine instruction may be emitted when calling the function. It would be useful for curious readers like me to document which instructions are generated for which architecture without reading the source code and tracking down calls to architecture-specific intrinsics.

Something like this would work:

```markdown
# Architecture-specific behavior
This function may emit a machine instruction, depending on target architecture support.
For architectures not on this list, this function does nothing.

Below is a table documenting the instruction emitted for each architecture:

| Architecture | Instruction |
|-|-|
| `x86` | [`pause`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/arch/x86/fn._mm_pause.html) |
| `x86_64` | [`pause`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/arch/x86_64/fn._mm_pause.html) |
| `riscv32` | [`pause`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/arch/riscv32/fn.pause.html) |
| `riscv64` | [`pause`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/arch/riscv64/fn.pause.html) |
| `arm` | [`yield`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/arch/arm/fn.__yield.html) |
| `aarch64` | [`isb`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/arch/aarch64/fn.__isb.html) |
```
